climbs.name: Tidal Fear
climbs.fa: Harold Hall, Greg and Chandler Orton, 2004.

content.description: Located towards the right (looking up) side of the SE wall of Tower of Doom as you enter a narrow pass in the saddle between Tower of Doom and the formation to the right of it. Follow bolt line to the summit of the Tower of Doom formation.
content.protection: Fixe SS 3/8 double expansion, no chains.
content.location: Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon Vol. 2: Umpqua map page 66-65, map 7 128, and GPS coordinates in UTM's page 127.

content.description: Fun route when clean but requires maintenance of which it has gotten behind in. Gloom of Doom and Doors of Durin climb the NE wall of Tower of Doom just uphill from the Baseline Trail just before it leaves the formation. Gloom begins about 20 feet uphill (right looking up) of Doors of Durin (5.9). Follow bolt line up steep slab to summit of Tower of Doom. Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon Vol. 2: Umpqua map 7 128.
content.protection: Fixe SS 3/8 double expansion, no chains.
content.location: Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon Vol. 2: Umpqua map page 66-65, map 7 128, and GPS coordinates in UTM's page 127.

content.description: Up hill from Bite the Edge in the middle of the SW buttress locate the left-slanting off-width crack. Start a few feet left (looking up) of the off-width following bolts to the top.
content.protection: Fixe SS 3/8 double expansion, no chains
content.location: Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon Vol. 2: Umpqua map page 66-65, map 7 128, and GPS coordinates in UTM's page 127.

content.description: Left of Balrogs. From the uphill saddle ridge climb up 5 feet (5.8) then up (5.7) Â to summit of Tower of Doom. Great views. Provides easy access to top anchors on Tower of Doom. This route is in shadows so expect some maintenance will be needed.
content.protection: Fixe SS 3/8 double expansion, no chains.
content.location: Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon Vol. 2: Umpqua map page 66-65, map 7 128, and GPS coordinates in UTM's page 127.

content.description: Just down slope of Gloom of Doom. Friction up bolt line up the lowest downhill leg of Tower of Doom. First 10 feet will be a little dirty in the best of times. Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon Vol. 2: Umpqua map 7 128.
content.protection: Fixe SS 3/8 double expansion, no chains
content.location: Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon Vol. 2: Umpqua map page 66-65, map 7 128, and GPS coordinates in UTM's page 127.

content.description: Shaded NW wall so expect to do some cleaning on your way up this short route. From the uphill most saddle ridge to Tower of Doom climb right 10 feet (balancy footwork, .10c) then up 2 bolts (5.7) to the summit of Tower of Doom. Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon Vol. 2: Umpqua map 7 128.
content.protection: Fixe SS 3/8 double expansion, no chains.
content.location: Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon Vol. 2: Umpqua map page 66-65, map 7 128, and GPS coordinates in UTM's page 127.

content.description: Begins at lower left (SW) buttress corner of the Tower of Doom formation. From corner move uphill 10 feet and follow bolt line up the buttress and onto the face to the top of the SW buttress. Fun exposure and one of the lower maintenance routes. Top anchors can be reached by way of French Door (5.8).
content.protection: Fixe SS 3/8 double expansion, no chains
content.location: SW buttress of Tower of Doom. Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon Vol. 2: Umpqua map page 66-65, map 7 128, and GPS coordinates in UTM's page 127.

content.description: There are seven established routes on Tower of Doom, three of which have a south aspect and are relatively low maintenance the remaining require annual maintenance. The French Door (5.8) provides a short easy access to the summit top anchors (no chains).   Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon Vol. 2: Umpqua map 6 page 123.
